runs.comm: left-arm over the wicket, starts on a shortish length but this slides down the leg side
on line this time, de Kock hops back and defends from the crease

got him, extra pace and bounce and de Kock feathers through to Dunk! Nothing stroke from de Kock, just hung his bat out - but the ball fair zipped through off the surface, seamed a fraction, took a small but visible deflection off the edge and South Africa are one down
back of a length, shuffles across and defends safely down on to the pitch

Bollinger is hammering in, hitting the deck hard and this flies through above shoulder height as Rossouw swats wildly at it - Dougie thought there may have been some glove involved, but no. Took a superb leap from Dunk to snag it
Rossouw on the charge, airy drive through point and Bollinger wants this one too, shouts of "CATCH!" but it's between two fielders and sprints away to the rope

lofted straight down the ground, four more! Length ball from Bollinger and although Rossouw swung across the line, he managed to bisect mid-on and mid-off with a leading edge and again the ball scoots away
pitched up from over the wicket, around off stump, watchfully defended by Hendricks
full and straight, this is clipped of the pads through square for a single
slightly back of a length, moves across outside off and taps back down the pitch
good lines from Faulkner, not offering any width, again Rossouw defends from the crease
brutal! Nothing wrong with this ball from Faulkner, on a good length, off-stump line but Rossouw whips his hands across the line and crunches four to deep midwicket

got him, slower ball and this time the leading edge is snaffled by Faulkner! He's a canny lad in this form of the game, Faulkner, although his back-of-the-hand delivery was heading down the leg side. Rossouw was done by the lack of pace, heaved to leg again, the edge ballooned back down the pitch and the bowler clutched it diving to his right
angled across the right-hander, who sits back and steers the ball to backward point on the bounce
on the stumps, Hendricks defends this time
shortish, Hendricks rocks back and clothes a pull down towards fine leg for one
good length, 138kph on off stump, presents a straight bat coming forwards
this flies through again from Bollinger, cuts Duminy in half as he tries to paddle across the line
squares him up slightly, staying on the back foot, Duminy manages to control an outside edge through gully for a single to get off the mark
bounds in, length ball around off stump, watchfully played into the off side
length delivery, Duminy comes forward on off stump, tapped into the covers
pitched up, tempting the drive and Duminy gets a low edge, falls short of keeper and slip... in fact, it bobbles between them and they pinch one
chipped back towards mid-off on the bounce and Hendricks takes on the arm, not sure who the fielder was but the throw missed with all three stumps to hit. Actually, Hendricks was in anyway
on the stumps, worked into a gap in the leg side for one
good length, straightens a touch off the angle, Hendricks is hit on the padding and Faulkner asks the questions - possibly too high
bit of width, Duminy rattles the hands through a rapier cut stroke and the ball flashes to the boundary
swing and miss this time, little bit of extra bounce for Abbott and the ball zips through
on the stumps, worked across the line to the leg side for another quick single
good lines, Hendricks is struggling to work the ball around here, blocked back down the pitch
oh, me and my mouth... this is crumped through midwicket, who could smell the freshly mown hay, that was so agricultural but it brings Hendricks four, shuffling back and roundhousing four
straight lines and Hendricks shovels one more to the leg side
over the wicket and sliding across, defended coming forwards
pitched up, Hendricks drives, a bump ball into the hands of Bollinger as he follows through
short of a length, Hendricks is quickly on to it, swivel-pulls in the air towards deep backward square, who takes it on the bounce
fuller and sliding on to the pads, Duminyn nibbles one more through backward square
good length on middle and leg, closes the face and works into a gap at midwicket, Maxwell scampers across to keep them to a single
lovely stroke from JP, leans into a slightly overpitched delivery and spanks it straight back down the ground for four
starts around the wicket, full and outside off and Hendricks drives, gets a thick edge wide of the keeper for a couple
tossed up, drifting across the right-hander, who plinks one into a gap at cover
flat trajectory, on middle and off stump, Duminy begins to close the face and gets a leading edge through mid-off
pushes this through a bit quicker, extra bounce beats the bat as Hendricks chops at it
floated up on off stump, pushed back to the bowler
worked away into the leg side and for a minute it looks as they might struggle for a second but Hendricks whirs back and makes his ground comfortably in the end
starts on a decent length, around off stump, Duminy plays it carefully back
shorter length, 136kph and Duminy has to hop back and get his bat behind it
short again, width encourages Duminy to have a dip, 139kph delivery flies through past the flailing bat edge
short again and climbing, this time he crouches out of harm's way
shortish, outside off, chopped into the ground straight to backward point
pitched up a fraction wide, Duminy reaches for the drive and finds the diving Maxwell equal to it at backward point again - a precious maiden for Postman Pat, who delivers again
lovely delivery to begin with, flighted and straightening to slip past the outside edge as Hendricks plays forward
a touch straighter, Henricks waits on it and pushes a single into the leg side
tossed up on the stumps, leans over the ball and flicks to the leg side

done him, Hendricks is down the river and stumped without a paddle! Superb work from Boyce, lured the batsman out but the ball dipped and he was nowhere near the pitch, just enough spin to go past the outside edge and he had no chance of regaining his ground

flighted, nice and straight, clumped towards mid-on and there's all sorts going on here! The ball bounces short of Faulkner but he snatches it and fires off a throw, Duminy is way down the pitch... but Boyce tries to deflect the ball on to the stumps first time, rather than collect it, which he had time to do
tossed up outside off stump and pushed into the covers for a single
fullish line on off stump, turned through the leg side for a single
back of a length, goes across and runs the ball down to third man
full again, not quite yorker length, punched towards mid-on for another single
short of a length and pushed across the left-hander, Duminy gets on top of it and steers through point
sharp bouncer, at the batsman, who takes evasive action
Behardien is done for pace here, the ball coming on at a clip and deflecting off the thigh pad behind square
flighted, on the stumps, Duminy can't get it through the infield at midwicket
shorter length, skids through outside off, slightly airy cut and it finds backward point
tossed up and worked to leg again, this time it beats the fielder and they get one
flighted, around middle and off, flicked to leg for another single
tossed up on the stumps, Duminy shovels to the leg side but can't get it through once again
slightly too full this time, bunted back on the off side for a single
short of a length, drops back and flicks a couple fine off the pads
gets across and pushes back down the track
shortish outside the line of off stump, rises up on his toes and punches a single through point
back of a length, middle and off stump, tapped into the covers
short again, Behardien jerkily pulls across the line and manages to squeeze one in front of square leg
sits back in the crease and deflects another single down to third man
comes forward and pushes a single to long-off

another one falls into Boyce's trap, stumped again! Think he saw Behardien coming, pushed his line a little wider, the batsman was reaching for it, well down the track, and Dunk was left with a simple piece of handiwork to finish it off
pushed through flatter, maybe a google, opens the face and steers to backward point
uses the feet, chops the ball into a gap on the leg side
tossed up, Duminy skips down the wicket, much closer to the pitch and pushes a single to long-off
Boyce lets slip a full toss but Miller can only bunt it into the ground, the bowler doesn't quite get a boot on it
floated up, Miller gets forward and punches back to the bowler
reverse the hands and manages to squirt the ball behind square
comes forward and driven down the ground for a single to long-off
tries to reverse sweep a full delivery, nearly yorks himself but manages to squeeze the ball out
punched down the ground to long-on this time
flighted, on off stump, driven firmly but straight back to the bowler
angled across, Miller swats at it but a top edge bounces well short of backward point
tossed up, Miller makes room and steers the ball through point
on the stumps, works a couple through square
Duminy advances, squirts a drive into the off side, there's plenty of room to spare in the MCG outfield and they scamper a couple
flatter, on leg stump and Duminy is hit on the pads trying to work across the line... Boyce appeals but think it pitched outside
tossed up and driven, not a clean connection, picks out mid-off
back of a length and fired thoguh the covers for a single to the sweeper
touch short, on the pads and Duminy fiddles at it, sounded like a thin nick through to Dunk... but replays show it scraped his trouser leg
bit of luck here but it brings a first boundary in almost ten overs, driving at a full ball and a thick edge squirts wide of the keeper for four
drops back, opens the face and runs a genuine single to third man
shuffles down the wicket, aiming a crashing drive through the covers but it spins low to backward point
good stuff from Abbott, on a length and beats the batsman for pace fishing in the channel outside off
steps to leg and shovels through midwicket as Faulkner follows him with the ball
pitched up on middle and leg, flicked fine but they don't manage a second, think Miller slipped when turning
fetch that! Length ball from Faulkner and Duminy finally sends one over the ropes, meaty swing to leg and the ball sailed h-i-i-i-i-i-g-h over deep square leg
slightly shorter, goes for the pull to leg again, gets a single to long-on
sliced and beyond the fingertips of backward point! Miller threw the hands at that, just managed to clear the man and it runs away for four

scooped high into the leg side, there's a man under this... gottim! Miller's time is up, aiming for the same boundary that Duminy cleared a few balls ago, got under it but didn't have the distance, taken comfortably a few yards in from the fence
length ball, little bit of width and McLaren swings hard, gets a thick edge down to third man
short and swatted through midwicket for another single
slightly back of a length outside off stump, attempted steer to third man misses out
another feisty bumper, McLaren had enough of those from Mitch Johnson earlier this year and sensibly ducks

another short ball, McLaren takes this one... and top edges to fine leg running in! This is pretty ordinary from South Africa, they're now six down and Cummins has the wicket he deserves. Dug in and angled across, McLaren was never in control of the shot and Faulkner hared in to take a good catch
touch short of a length, runs a single to third man
pitched up, nicely timed back down the ground and they get two as long-on jogs across to cut it off
advances, length ball from Faulkner, maybe a change of pace and Duminy misses heaving across the line
on the stumps, squeezes one out into the leg side

Duminy hoicks a fullish ball high towards wide long-off - but it's taken on the run by Finch! The Aussies are waltzing here, they've nipped out the SA captain and still the score is below 100. The umpires checked for the no-ball but he had a smidge of rubber behind the line
takes the pace off, outside the line of off stump, bottom-edged through to the keeper
back of a length, again can't get it away
good pace from Cummins, an inside edge deflects on to the pads, they steal one as the bowler pounds down the pitch in his follow through
excellent bouncer from Cummins, again Parnell swipes at thin air
back of a length, flying through over the stumps, Parnell leans back and fails to connect
slower ball from Cummins this time, room for Parnell to swing the arms, chops one through mid-off

length ball on middle stump, Abbott drives off the back foot, Cameron White picks it up to his left at extra cover, swivels and throws... a direct hit would do it but the ball bounces safely by. That's the Saffer 100 up
in the blockhole and Parnell manages to club another single back past the bowler - Cummins and Australia won't mind that, they've managed to limit South Africa to just 101
